com.magnet.android.mms

Class MagnetMobileClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.MagnetMobileClient

  • public class MagnetMobileClient
extends Object
    MagnetMobileClient is the starting class for initializing the Magnet MobileServer library. It provides a single entry point for initialization of global resources and the Magnet mobile engine.

    The following sample shows how to use this class to authenticate a connection to the Magnet backend and get a controller instance for making requests: 

    
   MagnetMobileClient magnetClient = MagnetMobileClient.getInstance(context.getApplicationContext());

   // create Magnet backend configuration
   String testHostUrl = "http://demo.xyz.com:8080/rest
   ConnectionConfigManager cm = magnetClient.getManager(ConnectionConfigManager.class, magnetClient.getAppContext());
   ConnectionConfig connection = cm.addOrReplaceConnectionConfig("demo", Uri.parse(testHostUrl),
      ConfigType.MAGNET_REST, MagnetRestAuthHandler.class, "magnet");

   // set credentials and save
   connection.setToken(TokenType.USERNAME, "test", true);
   connection.setToken(TokenType.PASSWORD, "password", true);

   // optionally authenticate
   boolean result = connection.getConnectionService().authenticate();

   // invoke the controller using the generated controller class from the mab tool
   HelloWorldControllerFactory helloFactory = new HelloWorldControllerFactory(magnetClient);

   String hello = "Hi there!";
   HelloWorldController hw = helloFactory.obtainInstance("demo");
   // invoke the method "getHello" - asynchronous call
   Call callResponse = hw.getHello(hello, null);
   // blocking until response is received from the backend
   String strResponse = callResponse.get();

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MagnetMobileClient getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves the singleton MagnetMobileClient instance for the specified application context. Only one instance of MagnetMobileClient is associated with a single application context.
        Parameters:
        context - The single global application context that is valid for the lifetime of the Android process. This is required for the MobileServer library so it can access Android Context related APIs, such as looking up resources, shared preferences, Android services, start activities, and so on.
        Returns:
        A global instance of MagnetMobileClient.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the application context is null.

      • getTypeDictionary

        public static com.magnet.android.mms.request.MagnetTypeDictionary getTypeDictionary()

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Call this method when you no longer need to use the MobileServer APIs. This method cleans up the global instance of MagnetMobileClient. A new global instance will be created the next time getInstance(Context) is invoked.

      • getAppContext

        public android.content.Context getAppContext()
        Retrieves the application context associated with this MagnetMobileClient.
        Returns:
        The application context associated with this MagnetMobileClient.

      • getManager

        public <T extends com.magnet.android.mms.ManagerInterface> T getManager(Class<? extends com.magnet.android.mms.ManagerInterface> managerClass,
                                                               android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves an instance of the specified manager associated with the context.
        Parameters:
        managerClass - A manager class, such as the ConnectionConfigManager.class.
        context - The context of the current Android component to be associated with the Manager object, such as an Activity, Service, or ContentProvider. Having a specific live context can be useful in cases where a context is required, such as popping up a dialog, starting an activity with a result code, or binding to an Android service.
        Returns:
        An instance of the specified manager.
        Throws:
        MobileRuntimeException - if a failure occurred when constructing a manager instance.

      • getConnectionConfigManager

        public ConnectionConfigManager getConnectionConfigManager()
        Convenience method to retrieve the application's ConnectionConfigManager
        Returns:
        The singleton ConnectionConfigManager.
